author: {'steamid': '76561198115820587', 'num_games_owned': 3074, 'num_reviews': 351, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1516701802}
review:
Plateforme/parkour 3D. Une triste histoire de méchant qui veut détruire le monde je crois.

Rising Islands c'est un jeu de course dans un environnement en 3D, c'est à dire que le but premier du jeu est d'aller d'un point A à un point B en suivant le chemin fléché qui nécessite quelques tricks. La "particularité" du titre, c'est de proposer un système de système de monde parallèle style Giana Sisters: un click on est dans le monde bleu, un autre click on est dans le monde rouge. Evidemment, certains passages demanderont d'être dans l'un ou l'autre des mondes pour progresser.

Le jeu est assez intéressant, à savoir que les mécaniques de jeu fonctionnent et que le level design possède quelques bonnes idées. Malheureusement, niveau technique c'est une autre paire de manche: caméra aux fraises même pendant les cinématiques, graphismes vraiment datés même si la DA est plutôt agréable, mais surtout trop d’imprécision dans la maniabilité, que amènera à des crises de nerfs et à des "putain de jeu de merde!" assez fréquent.

La balade reste cependant agréable, ça se termine en un peu moins de 2h si on désire chercher les quelques fragments éparpillés dans les niveaux, mais ça ne révolutionnera malheureusement pas un genre pourtant assez peu représenté, loin de là.

review:
In Rising Islands you have to balance the world by collecting crystals in different levels. The game is a Jump n’ Run with a working Wallrun, which is a lot of fun. But first of all the negative points:
The game is really short and has only 13 levels and it has an amazing number of bugs. In addition, the graphics are not pretty in my opinion. Also the controls are sometimes not entirely clear. The story is a joke and collectibles are damn easy to find. Nevertheless, I rate the game positively, the game has a really good and fun movement and move-abilities. The audio is also quite good and there is a Speedrun-Mode which is certainly a lot of fun. In addition, there are 3 types of level so there is more variety and the difficulty increases very well.So you should not have much time, not interested in good graphics, but want to play a fun Jump n Run you do nothing wrong with Rising Islands, but the normal price of 10€ is too high in my opinion, you should rather wait for a good sale. ( Or keypages)

Total 6/10 – So a buy recommendation, but only for a cheaper price and if you like, like me, 3D Jump n Runs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041923980', 'num_games_owned': 857, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1530825905}
review:
BOY what a fun game! Where it got the platforming right, it did get it damn right and it felt like I was always in motion, always jumping, shifting and having to stay on my toes about where to go and which dimension to use. I loved the animations for the main character, especially the flips and that hand-touching while she runs across walls. EPIC! 

[b]Controls:[/b]
The controls could have been tighter, because for how fluid and fast-paced the game looks, it doesn't quite play like it. I played it on a PS4 controller and the mid-air movements varied between super rigid or ridiculously oversensitive, so that I'd mess up a jump the first time because the character wouldn't go where I wanted her to and then the second time, she'd go there, to the moon and back and then throw in a pirouette before falling to her death.

[b]Death:[/b]
Which brings me to dying. I died a lot, about as often through my own fault as through the game's, but you get put back very close to the point of your demise. The transition happens fast and there's no penalty for dying, so this doesn't strike me as overly negative.

[b]Difficulty:[/b]
There was one section where I got a bit frustrated, because the premise seemed like fun (jumping across descending dimension rocks to make it across a gap), but the execution ended up making it the most difficult part of the whole game for me. But maybe that's just me not being a pro gamer. Other than that, the game was easy enough with just enough bite to keep you interested. I was wary of getting the game because another commenter stated that the game required a lot of precision, but I didn't find that to be the case except for a small handful of jumps where you learned how you had to move rather quickly.

[b]Conclusion[/b]:
This game is neat. It's very short (got 100% in just under 2 hours), so I definitely wouldn't recommend it for the full price. I got it on sale for about two bucks and that was absolutely worth it! If the controls worked better and there was a workshop support so that the community could post levels, I'd throw my money at the developers like crazy. But given the way it is, it has the nice optics, enjoyable music, a character that resembles Katara from AtlA (yes, that's what sold me, fight me) to recommend it. 

6/10  I want more

author: {'steamid': '76561198116707297', 'num_games_owned': 1826, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1528672759}
review:
I went into this game a bit hesistant since it currently has a mixed rating on steam.  I enjoy 3d platformers and good 3d platformers are really hard to come by so I figured I would give it a shot when it went on sale, I'm really glad I did.  

This game is not a collectathon style 3d platformer like so many games in the genre are, despite the fact that it is 3d, the levels themselves are very linear, there is virtually no exploring other than running to a random corner to find hidden gems which don't do anything other than unlock an achievement.  In my opinion this is a good thing, and rather than focus on exploring every nook and cranny, the gameplay is solely focused on solid platforming.

Platforming in this game is a lot of fun, the controls are simple and responsive and the camera is surprisingly good for such a low budget title, and it will rarely get in the way.  Your main character can switch between red and blue, when you are red, then you have access to various red pathways(walls you can climb on, rails you can grind on, platforms to jump on etc) but you will also be susceptible to red hazards such as landmines, gears, and electrical fields, while you will be safe from blue hazards but unable to access blue pathways.  With a touch of a button, the world is reversed.  Platforming involves some fairly tricky sections where you are forced to quickly switch colors as you jump through and around red and blue environments.  

The platforming is fast,  a ton of fun, and it feels really satisfying to traverse the environment.  The challenge level in this game is just right, you will die, but you will rarely get frustrated, checkpoints are everywhere, and every time you complete a tricky section you will hit a checkpoint so you almost never need to redo a part that may have frustrated you.   The game is on the short side, 13 levels which took me about an hour and a half to beat which is not bad but if you feel like that is too low playtime for $10 then wait for a sale.  

I have seen many reviews criticize the story, and I have to say that is probably the dumbest criticism ever levied against a game like this.  Yes, the story is nonsense, but it does not get in the way, and this is a 3d platofrmer, they virtually always have a throwaway story, why should a game of this budget get held to a higher standard then the greatest 3d platformers ever made(yes, Mario, I'm looking at you).

Overall, rising islands is a great game and is well worth your time if you enjoy platformers, wait for a sale if you feel like $10 is too much for a short game but definitely do not overlook this game.

悪い意味で凡ゲー。一部で極端に忙しい操作を要求される以外は、画面に要求されるままにボタンを押すだけと行った感じの、平凡なゲーム。赤と青の姿を切り替えて進むと言うシステムが、余計に「言われたままにボタンを押してる感」を強くさせている。ジャンプやギミックでの壁走りなど全体として動きが固く、操作に慣れて上手く動かせるようになっていくよりも、ステージギミックを暗記して、次は青次は赤、途中でジャンプなどのようにパターンだけで進んで行く場面が多い。そしてゲームのボリュームも少ないので、実際それだけでクリアーまで到達してしまう。いずれにしても、操作性が良いゲームでもないので、これ以上プレイヤースキルを要求されるステージが増えても、それはただ鬱陶しいだけになった可能性も高い。

全体としてはそれなりにプレイできるし、クリアーまでそれなりに進んでは行けるゲームなので、極端なクソゲーと言う事は無い。ただ、プレイしていて達成感や、操作の面白さ、ステージギミックの解法で頭を悩ますなど、プレイヤーが能動的に楽しむ場面が少なかった。結論としては最初に書いたように「悪い意味で平凡なゲーム」ということになると思う。積極的に買うなと言ったゲームでも無いが、あえてこのゲームを買ってプレイする意味は感じられない。

author: {'steamid': '76561198005648447', 'num_games_owned': 5290, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1510357330}
review:
[i]Je ne suis pas du genre à descendre un jeu indépendant quand un certain effort est fait pour concevoir un jeu cohérent. Je veux dire, ça devient tellement l'hécatombe sur Steam depuis 2 ans que le moindre jeu indépendant qui fait tout pour se faire respecter devient, en comparaison, un bon jeu – du moins, un jeu « honnête ». Le problème, c'est que Rising Islands remplit tout juste le cahier des charges.[/i]

Il est question dans ce jeu de plateforme d'atteindre le bout de chaque niveau, une sorte de parcours du combattant, en activant la touche action (RT) pour s'agripper à des surfaces magnétiques. Il s'agit alors, à l'instar d'[b][i]Ikaruga[/i][/b] et d'[b][i]Outland[/i][/b], de passer d'une polarité à l'autre (LT), suivant la couleur de l'obstacle, pour interagir avec lui. Quant aux murs ou plateformes colorées, il faudra basculer de la couleur rouge à bleu, et vise versa, pour faire les faire disparaître ou apparaître, suivant qu'on cherche à se frayer un chemin ou éviter la mort. Un concept donc simple mais pas tout neuf, réutilisé ici à la sauce « plateforme 3D ». Hélas, les niveaux peinent à vaincre l'ennui, et se contentent bien souvent de répéter les mêmes passages. Je ne nie pas que de nouveaux éléments apparaissent quelques rares fois (la possibilité de dasher, des jumpers qui demandent d'appuyer au bon moment et avec la bonne polarité, etc.) mais le level design global manque sincèrement d'imagination : rien ne vient rendre un niveau mémorable, unique. http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1196351453

En parlant de complétion, il faudra se contenter de 13 niveaux, allant de 5 à presque 20 minutes pour les 3 derniers. On vient donc à peine de débarquer pour collecter des gemmes sans significations pour repartir quitter sur des crédits après une absence de narration qui frôle l'indolence au bout de 3 petites heures. Si c'est pour négliger le scénario, chers développeurs, arrêtez de nous faire croire qu'il y a un objectif derrière nos actions : on joue à un jeu de plateforme pour le plaisir des actions périlleuses ; vous le savez, on le sait, ne vous sentez pas obligés, vraiment. http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1201810010

Pas un grand mal, mais c'est sans compter la présence de bugs et autres problèmes de jouabilité. Je passe donc les dashs qui rendent parfois impossible les raccords sur des prises murales magnétiques – l'animation devant en fait prendre fin, c'est presque un échec sur deux –, la rigidité cadavérique des sauts, … Non, le pire, le cauchemar, ce sont ces barres de grind avec lesquelles la collision fonctionne au petit bonheur la chance. Vous voilà donc prêt à terminer un parcours de sauts quand votre personnage finit, ô rage, par traverser la rambarde en question  http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1201811859

La direction artistique est à l'image de la pauvreté du gameplay : une seule piste sonore et des textures dégueulasses dans un troisième monde artistiquement in-inspiré ; c'est probablement ce terme qu'il faudra retenir au regard de l'expérience complète proposée par Rising Islands... Allez les gars, la prochaine fois on arrête les démo techniques et on nous concocte un jeu passionnant, ok ?

review:
[h1]Rising Islands, Sinking flaws	[/h1]

Rising Islands is a third person 3D platformer,  One that has both and well positioned camera, and at the same time stubbornly locked forward through  the level, at all times.
It's fine in that, from there i can judge my jumps. But The way it's forced, is rubish. a huge problem just looking for collectibles, and otherwise exploring the map. 

And because it has to be so limiting, the controls are also a problem.
Imagine it as driving a vehicle, controlling it only with WASD. you can't suddenly stop and turn around, you can't strafe, and you sure as hell cant control the movement with the camera.

That's how the game is made to be, and after awhile i got used to it. It has potential, but somehow came out a bit clunky.
This much i accepted and took it for what it was and had a good time. 

I actually had problems with the game that need and should get fixed:
- issues with DS4, and i actually had to unplug the controller
- Sensitivity options seem to only work for the controller, the mouse can barely move the camera 
- The camera is poorly placed in almost every cutscene
- there should be some visual and audio queues, i'm aware the game is rather forgiving, but some segments are just  blue squares on top of blue objects mixed with red squares and red objects. sometimes while climbing a wall i had to assume there is another wall in front of me, because the camera doesn't turn around to show it like in Lvl 1

review:
I honestly say that I tried to enjoy this game. It seems like a fun game but there are a few issues that cause me to not want to play any more than past the 3rd level. Keep in mind i used KB/M for my experience.

-Bugs. One specific one I've noticed is in level selection. You go in, can't select your level, exit out, go back in and can select it again. Easy bug to go around, not a big deal but on top of other things it's quite annoying.

-Incorrect tutorial prompts. One specifically that tells you to use Shift+Space to wallrun, coming from Cloudbuilt, that makes sense. In reality to wallrun all you have to do is have shift held when near a wall. If you try to press space when around a wall, you'll immediately jump off, caused quite a few unnecessary deaths. Admitidly so, it is partly my fault for not fixing my habits, but the game tells you how to do an integral part of the game incorrectly.

-Camera. The camera work is absolutely terrible. For the three levels I did play, it felt like I was constantly fighting the camera to see where i wanted to look. I even changed my mouse's settings for max DPI and it still felt like the camera was constantly trying to snap back to where I wasn't trying to look. It's hard to explain, but it felt like it kept pushing back towards the MC's line of sight. With lots of corners and trying to move fast, fighting with the camera isn't something I want to have to do.

-Respawn. I have three points with this one, the first is that there is no quick respawn. You have to wait for the whole scene for the MC to die, even if you know you've missed a jump, you don't have a button to just respawn. The second is that there is no key locking while respawning, after the screen turns dark you can move from the respawn point, changing the camera angle, and changing from red to blue or vice versa. Lastly you keep the same camera angle that you had when you died. If you took a 90 degree turn before you died because there was a corner before the next checkpoint, you respawn facing a wall or a cliff, if you missed your jump and tried to salvage it because theres no quick respawn and you end up dying facing the wrong way, you start facing backwards. Minor complaint, but on top of fighting with the camera, it's quite annoying to come back like that.

review:
Poco se puede decir de Rising Islands que no se vea ya en el trailer, el juego está centrado en un sistema de Parkour con un sistema de cambios de colores (para poder seguir avanzando) que pondrá a la prueba a los menos iniciados en este tipo de género. Peca de ser bastante cortito y lo podrían haber solucionado de manera sencilla con un editor de niveles de la comunidad el cual hubiese permitido aprovecharlo más!
 
+El Parkour está bastante bien hecho y resulta entretenido ir consiguiendo los objetivos.
+Nuevas habilidades según progresas que irán ayudante a avanzar.
+Tiene un modo contrareloj para medirte en tiempos con el resto de jugadores!
+El juego está bien adaptado al mando de la 360.
+Cromos!

=Tiene coleccionables, pero al ser lineal estos no van a estirar el juego más de 10 minutos.

-Se nota que es indie y por ello tiene algunos apartadas que son bastante pobres, las animaciones por ejemplo.
-La duración, no te dará ni para 3 horas completar el juego al 100% y con todos los logros.
-La historia es muy simple y poco rebuscada, por lo que no le prestarás mucho interés.
-Aunque pone que está traducido al Español, me ha salido todo el juego en inglés menos las tres últimas pantallas.


Puntuación: 7
Conclusión: El juego es divertido, así que si te gusta el Parkour y lo pillas en oferta lo recomiendo, aunque no te durará más de una tarde!

author: {'steamid': '76561198120414526', 'num_games_owned': 1205, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1496843699}
review:
[h1][b]概要[/b][/h1]

９０％ＯＦＦのクーポンをもらったので購入。
青と赤の力を切り替えてゴールを目指すパルクール系３Ｄアクションゲーム。
ストーリーモードとタイムアタックモードの２モードが存在しています。
難易度は標準的で、簡単すぎず、難しすぎずの程よい感じ。
日本語はありませんが、ストーリーモードの話の流れさえ気にしなければ、何の問題もなくプレイできます。[spoiler]まあ大したストーリでもないですし[/spoiler]


[h1][b]悪いところ[/b][/h1]
[list]

[*][b]ボリューム不足[/b][list]
　[*]ストーリーモードのステージ数は３ワールド１５ステージと少なめで、１時間～３時間あれば余裕でクリアできてしまいます。下手なワンコインゲーでももっとボリュームがあると思うのですが……。
　[*]タイムアタックモードが本番なのかというとそうでもなく、ストーリモードから抜粋した数ステージを走ることができるだけ。ランキングこそあれど、専用の追加ステージなんてものはありません。[/list]

[*][b]セーブデータの仕様[/b][list]
　[*]セーブデータが存在しているときにニューゲームを押すと、即座に以前のセーブデータが削除されます。確認もなしにいきなり消えるので、ミス操作だけはくれぐれもご注意を……。[/list]

[*][b]貧弱なグラフィック[/b][list]
　[*]このゲームの貧弱なグラフィックやモーション、カメラワークを見ていると、ＰＳ２あたりのゲームを思い出します。[list]
　　[*]とくにカメラワークはこの手のゲームとしては最悪で、せっかくの良点である順調に走れているときの爽快感を邪魔することが多々。
　　[*]そのくせ要求スペックは高いため、低価格なＰＣでのプレイはおすすめできません。[/list][/list]

[*][b]ビデオ設定[/b][list]
　[*]解像度やフルスクリーン設定が、ゲーム起動時やビデオ設定画面を開く度にリセットされたりされなかったりします。[/list]

[*][b]バグ[/b][list]
　[*]時間制限のあるステージを失敗しリトライをすると、その後すべてのステージでジャンプ後の着地モーションが出なくなり、地面を空中でジャンプしているモーションのままスライド移動するようになり、爽快感とかけ離れたシュールな状態になります。[list]
　　[*]ただ、この状態でポーズメニューを開き、ゲームに戻ればこのバグは治ります。インパクトこそあれ深刻なバグではありません。[/list][/list]

[*][b]ダッシュの操作性[/b][list]
　[*]十字キーで飛ぶ方向をある程度まで指定できるのですが、暴発してずれた方向に飛ぶことが多いです。[list]
　　[*]多少細かいダッシュ操作を必要とする極一部のギミックではすこしストレスになるかもしれません。[/list][/list]
[/list]

[h1][b]まあまあなところ[/b][/h1]
[list]

[*][b]一部ギミックがガバガバ[/b][list]
　[*]一部の床の判定や、ギミックの設計がガバガバで、正攻法でないゴリ押しが通用する場所があります。[list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198025796747', 'num_games_owned': 5088, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1490796134}
review:
[h1]Pros[/h1]
Oriental influenced soundtrack and character design
Neat wallrunning and dimension shift mechanics
Time trials great for speedrunning

[h1]Cons[/h1]
Short
Buggy
Lacks polish
Lousy story
Platforming flow just sucks
Too much precision required

I seriously wanted to like this one; it's a shame that this honestly has too many flaws associated with it. Rudimentary bugs that anyone could find suggests that this game was either QA-tested incompetently, or not at all. The story isn't great either, all you have to do is to rescue crystals and relics from some evil guy, and the ending is a complete cop-out. It's also hampered by a lousy stock font.

Levels aren't really designed that great either; you cannot really seem to maintain a nice flow of running and platforming because some elements are designed in such a way that it kills the flow. There's a ludicrous amount of precision required to solve specific challenges, and the fact that the checkpoint system is also inconsistent makes this a rather more irritating experience as you go along.

I was pretty happy when I finally finished it, because the last few levels were the most annoying of the lot, where all the problems I have were exhibited to the fullest. Plus, the game never ran particularly well on my own computer even at lowest settings, making all these a lot worse. It can usually handle other games at 60 FPS on lowest, but this never comes anywhere close.

That said, I love the soundtrack and hope to get it later on. The oriental Chinese flavour to it as well as the instrumentation gives it some fantasy epic feel to it, saving it from almost complete mediocrity. That and the relatively fast 100% achievements (I took only 2-3 hours to beat it, and that was after one of the aforementioned bugs made me start the game from scratch after about 1 hour in, and 2 hours of card idling time).

[h1][b]When to buy[/b][/h1]
I don't regret my purchase a lot since I was lucky to snag a 90% off coupon. If you want to get it though, get it on sale. The short length means that it isn't worth $10.

[h1]3.0/10[/h1]

review:
[i]Это уже было в[/i] [i][strike]Симпсонах[/strike][/i] [i]Принце Персии.[/i]

Паркур - это безумный восторг и адреналин, это чувство безграничной свободы, это когда ветер свистит в ушах и бьёт в лицо, это феерические прыжки, безостановочное движение вперёд-вперёд, только вперёд...
В общем, нувыпонели - всего этого в игре нет и в помине.

Зато есть короткие пробежки продолжительностью в несколько секунд, потом дооооолгое падение в пропасть и дооооолгая загрузка, после чего всё повторяется снова. Драйвом здесь и не пахнет. Падать или испытывать другие трагические смерти приходится постоянно, в первую очередь благодаря камере, которая всячески старается показать процесс из самого неудобного ракурса. Управление тоже имеет свой шарм - к примеру, если видишь платформу слева, то не всегда доречно наклонить стик геймпада влево, чтобы попасть на неё.

Структура уровней проста, как конструкция цвяха. Обычно это коротенький кишкообразный коридор, по которому нужно пробежать из точки А в точку Б, попутно отвлекаясь на сбор кристаллов. В строго определённых участках можно побегать по стенам и почувствовать себя на мгновение прынцом известного восточного государства. Зато во всех подряд текстурах можно застрять, причём намертво, вплоть до принудительного перезапуска уровня. В некоторых местах явно задумывался один способ прохождения, но доступен другой (вместо сложной пробежки по стенам пропасть можно просто перепрыгнуть). Дизайнерам - неуд с плюсиком.

Сюжет присутствует для галочки. Вот вы - уличная [strike]девка[/strike] девочка, chosen one, вот плохой дядя, вот мир, жаждущий спасения, и чарівні кристаллики "всех их вместе собери и что будет посмотри". Причём даже такой простой сюжет так и не был раскрыт и доведён до логического финала.

Графика - яркая феерия минимализма с лысыми текстурками, типатакмодно, но глаз радует. Движения героини плавные и вполне естественные (кроме анимаций гибели).
Музыка есть. Лучше бы её не было, но эта неприятность легко решается выключением колонок.

И тем не менее, несмотря на все огрехи, в игре есть что-то чарующее, сказочное. Некая милота, ради которой усмиряешь нервные клетки и запускаешь уровень снова. Может, в надежде таки получить адреналин от паркура. Может, просто привлекает милая попка очередной спасительницы мира. Видно, что авторы старались. Получилось бюджетненько, примитивно, но "с душой" (хотя багов и больше, чем этой самой эфемерной души).

Напоследок немножко поною.
Последний уровень пришлось перепроходить четыре раза. Первый раз - управление само собой переназначилось. После второго раза не открылась концовка, героиня получила последний кристалл, вернулась в главную комнату и... всё. Третий раз - я верил в чудеса, но концовка так и не открылась. И наконец только в четвёртый раз удалось побороть систему. Если вас постигнет та же неудача - открывайте реестр (да-да, у разработчиков хватило фантазии сохранять игру в реестре!), находите ветку
HKCU\SOFTWARE\Lone Hero Studios\Rising Islands
и удаляйте WorldCrystal13_h3018971079, в результате чего прогресс последнего уровня обнулится, и после его повторного прохождения вам, возможно, повезёт.

[b]Оценка[/b]: 48 / 100.
[b]Вердикт[/b]: коротенькая ни на что не претендующая забавка, которая может доставить пару часов мазохистского удовольствия.

review:
This is one of those games whose trailers look a lot more appealing than the game itself actually is. What is present has some care put into it, and has a good concept overall, however the execution is pretty bare bones. When similar titles i.e. any Prince of Persia cost a similar amount and are made with more polish (such as character models, or music -the same music track repeats often in this game-) it's hard to recommend this. If you look at the trailers for the game closely, there is very limited actual gameplay shown, I think this is because the lack of polish would begin to show relatively quickly. While you're running along and flowing with the levels is fine enough, but the concept of "shifting dimensions" similar to the game Outland or Ikaruga begins to wear thin early. Simple cutscene animations attempt to weave an intricate storyline, however their bland presentation fails to invest the player toward much. 

The game feels like it's still in early access in many ways, from the bland UI to the poor translation, it feels almost as if it were developed on a limited budget for ios. Some may find it enjoyable but I found myself with immediate buyer's remorse after actually playing it for a bit opposed to the expectations the trailers had crafted.

review:
A fun, fluid Platform game. I tried it at an event, and bought it on the spot I liked it so much.

The game is based around a simple mechanic - shifting between two different colour dimensions, red and blue. You can only interact - for better or worse - with anything in the same dimension as you. This means you can make floors dissappear, create paths to run along, or dodge an explosion by shifting between the two.

Built on top of this is a parkour platformer, with fluid, intuative controls, and a wonderful "Lost World" asthetic.

about the only minor issue is the automatic camera doesn't always follow you, but easially fixed with full manual camera control always availiable on the second stick. Controller is highly recommended for this game

Perfect if you liked the time trials in mirror's edge, the polarising mechanic in Ikaruga or pretty much any part of CloudBuilt. Great for SpeedRunners.

[i]Indie Plattform Action Abenteuer in 3rd Person mit „Dimensionswechsel“[/i]

[h3]Das Spiel[/h3]
Rising Island ist eine Indie Entwicklung was man auch recht schnell merkt! Man läuft mit Hairo rasant über, an und durch Wände und muss so ans Ziel kommen. Je schneller umso besser! Leider funktionieren der Dimensionswechsel und die Hindernisse nicht immer reibungslos, was durchaus mal frustrieren kann. Meist behebt man die Bugs mit einem Levelneustart und freut sich umso mehr den Abschnitt bewältigt zu haben

+ kunterbunte Grafik, wenn auch ausbaufähig
+ passende Musik im Orientalischen Stil
+ Passagen recht fordernd

[h3]Negativ[/h3]
- keine Sprachsynchronisation
- Bugs die dir einen perfekten Run vermiesen könnten

[h3]Fazit[/h3]
Rasanter Indie Action Plattformer in solider Qualität!

[h1]🎮Rising Islands🎮[/h1]
[i]Indie platform action adventure in 3rd person with "dimension change"[/i]

[h3]The game[/h3]
Rising Island is an indie development which you notice pretty fast! You run with Hairo rapidly over, on and through walls to get to the goal. The faster the better! For a little variety there are 13 different levels and the time mode. It' not easy to get through, because the walls and barriers are in different "dimensions". So you have to coordinate switching Hairo between the red and blue dimension several times during the parcours. This works pretty well after a little practice.

The colorful graphics are not the best I've ever seen from an indie studio, but they are still solid! The music has an oriental touch which I personally liked! Unfortunately, the dimension changes and the hurdles do not always work smoothly, which can be quite frustrating. Most times you fix the bugs with a level restart and feel all the more happy to have mastered the section.

[h3]Positive[/h3]
+ colorful graphics, although expandable
+ suitable music in oriental style
+ Passages quite challenging

[h3]Negative[/h3]
- no voiceover
- Bugs that could ruin a perfect run for you

[h3]Conclusion[/h3]
Fast-paced indie action platformer in solid quality!

author: {'steamid': '76561198144073426', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1470794905}
review:
Итак, эта игра планировалсь или на консоли, или затачивалась под джостик,  и может быть именно на них и надо играть. А вот на ПК это печаль и боль. 
Во первых "тугое" управление. И камера, и движения, даже на максимальной чувствительности тугие ,очень тугие. Героиня бежит с таким заносом, словно она груженный самосвал на скрости за 150 км/ч. Как итог ,даже простая задача с прыжками, где вы сразу понимаете ЧТО нужно сделать, превращается в череду попыток. 

Так же местами на трамплинах иначиная с 3го уровня забавный факт: вы должны запргынуть на платформу с трамплином, но так просто это не получиться - сама она не может попасть. Пролетит мимо, перелетит, не допрыгнет.  Как итог - выверивание угла прыжка, места откуда прыгать, и доворот камерой. 

Логические задачи с 2мя цветами, за частую накладываються друг на друга и вместо платформ/ловушек - цветная непонятная масса текстур. 

Язык - вроде и ставишь русский, но вот новый уровнь и субтитры снова по умолчанию на английском. Еще раз меняешь язык - и порой замечаешь, что местами простейшие yes\no так и не переведены ( смысл понятен, да, но если делаете перевод, так хоть не халтурить) 

Графика - куча позиций графики от "Быстрой" до "Фантастической" - и вроде идея хорошая, но игра не выглядит как суровая нагрузка для систем. При том что действительно хорошая графика только на максимальных значениях. 

Музыка: Возможно в дальнейшем она и будет радовать разнообразием, но пока довольно однообразна, а учитывая управление и частые попытки, допрыгнуть - скорее разражает, чем радует. 

Мир: Хоть искать его в таких игрушках глупо, НО , нам дали сюжет, с борьбой добра и зла. При этом это простые, ОЧЕНЬ простые уровни. Без задников, окружения, или динамических объектов. Обычная горка покрытая цветами, дорога, платформы для прыжков и цветы тут и там. Вот и все что здесь есть. 

Плюсы:  + идея
              + местами гемплей

Минусы:  -  графика
               - тугое управление
               - "Сырость" игры 
               - перевод

Итог: Любителям аркад и платформеров, но только при большой скидке. И готовте геймпад, иначе готовте нервы.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038159095', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1470321955}
review:
Zlo tady vždy bylo. Ono tady stále je a zřejmě také i bude. Dokud se zlo bude stále objevovat v celém, nám všem známém, světě, tak se ho nezbavíme ani v médiích, kde se proti samotnému zlu bojuje. Proti onomu nejzákeřnějšímu zlu zápasíte i v nyní recenzované hře Rising Islands, který se snaží uspět nejen svojí stylizací do klasických skákaček, jako například byl Crash Bandicoot, či Prince of Persia, ale také pohádkovým motivem. Povedl se autorům tento přenos do oldschoolu anebo se bude jednat o naprostou koninu, která bude těžit pouze z nostalgie starších hráčů?
Příběh je naprosto prostý. Kdysi byli tři strážci a chránili takzvané kameny moci. Ovšem si jeden ze strážců řekl, že si chce urvat kousek ony moci pro sebe, a tak ukradl několikero kamenů a zmocnil se dvou světů ze tří. Tímto zbylí dva strážci, jeden modrý a druhý červený, poprosí o pomoc Hairo. Dívku, která se ochomýtá kolem. Joooo, hlubší motiv v tom nehledejte. Každopádně nemáte nic lepšího na práci, než právě onoho strážce porazit a tím následně zachránit celý svět… Cítíte tu originalitu? Nebojte se, já taky ne.
Co vás tedy ve hře vlastně čeká? Musíte se dostat do tří světů a v každém z nich připravit třetího strážce o všechny kameny moci, aby nenabral potřebnou energii k zabrání celého světa. Právě když se třetímu strážci díky kamenům daří světy zamykat, tak vám se je daří odemykat.
Abyste si však nemysleli, že to bude jen tak – ve světě Rising Islands na vás čekají také různorodé nástrahy. Těm se musíte vyhýbat nejen svými akrobatickými schopnostmi, ale také svými reflexy. Tedy abyste mě nechápali špatně: Oba strážci co vás požádali o pomoc, vám každý dal kus ze sebe. To znamená, že se dokážete ze sekundy na sekundu teleportovat do jiné dimenze, myslím tím do modré či červené. Hodí se vám to hlavně v případě, kdy jsou některé zdi modré a některé červené a můžete po nich lézt pouze v dimenzi příslušné barvy. To stejné s překážkami. Když je nástraha například červená a vy jste přeměnění na druhou barvu, tak se vám nic nestane, v opačném případě na vás zaklepe zubatá. Tato schopnost vám tak nabízí úplně unikátní hratelnost. Nejen že se musíte potýkat s velmi kreativními způsoby akrobatických překážek, ale také při jednotlivých skocích musíte měnit barvy jako na běžícím páse. K tomu se přes každý svět dostávate přes rozličné nebezpečenství a díky tomuto tak problém stereotypu zaniká. K tomu nasvědčuje taky fakt, že ve všech úrovních v jednom světě se pouze snažíte chytnout kámen moci a nejste nijak vázaný na čas. Ovšem v předposlední úrovni vždy narazíte na kámen nestabilní a budete muset bojovat s časem, aby se vám artefakt nerozpadl, dokud ho nechytnete. Poslední úroveň je pak věnována střetům mezi vámi a třetím strážcem, kdy se mu snažíte ukrást poslední kámen daného světa přímo před ksichtem, jak se říkává.
Bohužel se titul nevyhnul problémům. Jedná se tedy hlavně o věci technického rázu. Většina her tohoto žánru má problém se „zlobivou“ kamerou. Zde to není výjimkou, a tak se mnohdy stane, že zkrátka nebudete vědět, kam skáčete. To se týká také občasným propadům snímků, kde se jedná o problém hlavně díky tomu, že záleží na vašich reflexech. Občas jsem si také všiml pozdější odezvy při skoku postavičky, když jsem zmáčkl na nějakou klávesu, ale nejde o tak častou záležitost, jako o věci předtím zmíněné.
A co grafika? Jak můžete vidět, je příjemná na pohled. Komiksový nádech hře jenom prospěl a dodává na pohádkovosti příběhu. Zároveň různé světy, do kterých se dostaneme, tak nejsou dělány jako přes kopírák. Každý svět je jiný a unikátní. První místo nás dostane do normální travnaté krajiny, místo druhé nás naopak zanese do doby ledové a trojka je cosi, kde vláda třetího strážce již více pokročila, a tak se setkáte také s jeho monumenty a zjistíte, jak taková vláda zla může být hrůzostrašná. Zároveň jde vidět, jak si autoři vyhráli s colorací. Tzn., že vždy když se přepnete do určité barvy, tak se lehce pozmění i barevný filtr. Na druhou stranu se nevyhneme bugům, kdy se například zaseknete uvnitř nějakého objektu, ale nejedná se o věc, která by nebyla nijak nevídaná.
Posledním bodem budiž soundtrack, který se mi líbil už hlavně z důvodu, že se jedná o orientální hudbu, která zkrátka patří mezi mé favority. Vhodné skladby, které podtrhují atmosféru, ať už tu klidnou, anebo tu napínavou, kdy probíháte, abyste v čas stihli sebrat nějaký kámen moci, to vše nám dotváří velmi slušné dílo.
Co říct na konec? Jakožto herní recenzent se naskýtám před dilematem, jelikož hra exceluje v obsahu. Rád jsem si zavzpomínal na dětství, kdy jsem na prvním Playstationu hrál Crashe anebo na starém dobrém PC Prince of Persia, ovšem hra je špatná v několika aspektech technických a popravdě je to škoda.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053788131', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 352, 'playtime_forever': 174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1470343860}
review:
NOTE: This game was given to me by the developer for review purposes. This did not influence my review in any way.

[h1]==========================================================
---------------------------------------OVERVIEW-------------------------------------
==========================================================[/h1]
Rising Islands is a third-person 3D platform game from a new indie development team.

You play an unnamed heroine with assumed responsibility for saving the world from chaos as a corrupted guardian attempts to use three relics for his own selfish means. By taking the power of dimension swapping and using various acrobatic feats to traverse the broken landscape floating in the sky, your goal is to retrieve the relics and restore their protection to the world. Or at least, that's what I've been able to pick up from a few hours of play, anyway.

[h1]==========================================================
----------------------------------------QUALITY-------------------------------------
==========================================================[/h1]
Graphics - Rising Islands' graphics vary considerably. The game uses cel shading to achieve a cartoon-like look, but even then, some of the textures are quite bland and the terrain geometry is uninventive and a bit boring, looking rather blocky and dated.

The character graphics are a mixed bag, too. The main character model is very good, but the textures aren't great. The corrupted guardian model and textures, too, are not that impressive, but the other guardians are quite creative, reminding me of Okami, for some reason.

The main character animations are really good, but even then there's a bug where they get stuck sometimes and you end up 'flying' around the level, stuck in the jumping animation instead of the sprinting one. The death animation is not that great, though, and the automatic camera sometimes gets stuck, making the screen bounce around like crazy.

The special effects when changing between the two dimensions and dashing are quite nice. Oh, and the title screen looks very nice, except for the broken model intersections that make it look like the grassy rise on which the character sits is swallowing her. This happens sometimes in game, too; I've had to restart levels because I've been stuck in terrain geometry or fallen through the floor.

Cut scenes are pretty bad, with a whole lot of seemingly slow motion animations and a lack of good sound effects or voices making them seem very unprofessional when compared with the rest of the game.

Graphics options are relatively standard for Unity, with a single detail setting ranging from 'Fastest' to 'Fantastic', resolution and windowing options, and anti-aliasing. I encountered a few minor performance issues on some levels on an old gaming laptop, but any new gaming machine should cope very well.

Sound - Sound effects do the job, but are basically forgettable. There are no voices. Music is great, with a nice oriental theme, but there seems to only be one track through most of the game (and title screen), so it wears thin after a while. The other track (on relic levels) is okay, too, but not quite as impressive.

Gameplay - Rising Islands plays like a typical 3D platform game: run, climb, and jump as you navigate through each stage from start to finish, collecting sometimes-hidden gems along the way. Each stage provides you with a power crystal, which is eventually used to open up a route to the next of the three game worlds, at the end of which you restore one of the protective relics. Each world of five stages includes a timed stage as well, but I found these more frustrating than fun, particularly the second one.

Right at the beginning of the game the primary gameplay 'hook' is introduced, albeit poorly, and you are given the ability to swap between two dimensions: red and blue. This gameplay hook is then used for nearly every platforming challenge in the game.

There's no real in-game explanation for the dimension-swapping ability, however, or for the guardians' choice of the player character, or her ability to run up walls, for that matter. It's unfortunate, too, because providing more information on the character and the game's lore would have added to the experience immensely. Contrast this with something like Prince of Persia (2008) and Rising Islands feels hollow and superficial, with no emotional investment from the player. 

Controls are simple and work reasonably well on both keyboard and controller, with full controller support. I played with keyboard to begin, just to test out the controls, but if you have a controller then use that; it's definitely a superior experience. Unfortunately they're a little bit 'loose', and you'll probably find yourself running off some ledges to your death when you're sure you pressed the jump button.

There are a few problems with the mostly good level design, too, with some challenges being very frustrating and based at least partly on the uncontrollable camera angle, and some others being easily circumvented (e.g. the first switch puzzle doesn't actually require you to use the switch at all). Prepare for very high frustration levels and rage quitting -- I've found it frustrating enough that I haven't yet been able to force myself to finish it.

The game includes Steam Achievements that you'll gain by carefully completing the game (with one requiring collection of every hidden crystal), and also includes a time trial mode to increase replayability.

[h1]==========================================================
-------------------------------------PROS & CONS------------------------------------
==========================================================[/h1]
Pros:
+ It's mostly pretty good fun
+ Some graphics are very good, including the main character animations and title screen
+ Full controller support or useable keyboard and mouse controls; both work well
+ Steam Achievements and Trading Cards

Cons:
- Camera, control, and level design frustrations hiding a relatively short game
- Game background and lore is minimal, but what is here has some grammar errors and could use a bit of work
- There's really only one hook in the game, so it gets a bit boring more quickly than it should
- Some graphics look rather dated, and there are lots of geometry intersection issues

[h1]==========================================================
--------------------------------------CONCLUSION-----------------------------------
==========================================================[/h1]
Rising Islands is a mostly fun 3D platformer that could do with a bit more polish. It's definitely not at the top of its genre, but it's worth playing. Just prepare for some rage.

[h1]6/10[/h1]

review:
Great platforming gameplay with challenging puzzles. It's also colorful and lovely to look at. The game gives me nostalgia to my childhoods ps2 games. The graphics feels inspired by Jak and Daxter, rachet and clank and such games. The gameplay remind however more of Sands of times jumping and running elements. 

The game is unfortunately a bit short I would have liked to see more and the flow in the gameplay makes you want to keep on playing even though the game is over. It's great for speed running. 

There are bugs (mostly graphical ones) and some cut-scene images and texts feels rushed together. Also is the narrative jumpy and almost non existing. But this is a game you play for the gameplay not for the story.

review:
I had fun with Rising Islands, and will most likely finished the game in the next few days. 
The game features some pretty sweet platforming, and now and then you will enter an almost zen-like flow.

The story & cutscenes are not nearly as good as the actual gameplay, which is sad but for a first game from an indie team that is understandable (also, they are skippable). The true strenght of Rising Islands is the core mechanics and level design, so the most important aspects are good enough that I can honestly recommend the game to anyone who enjoys this sort of flowing platformer. 

during my 50 or so minutes with the game I managed to get to the 2nd world out of three that you can see from the start, so it's probably not a terribly long game, but it does require your full concentration, and fast fingers.
I might update this review after I finished the game, but for now I need to rest my thumbs!

review:
Rising islands premises is great with an interesting artstyle and set of mechanics. Sadly, those mechanics are executed at a sub par level with to many bugs.

Full review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Rnl0jkShjF4&ab_channel=GuyLogic

Text:
The game slowly introduces mechanics that are quite interesting using the tried and true "dimension switching" to traverse level in various Puzzle-platform-speedrunner.... esque ways. Sadly, 13 levels is way to few and by the time you get a roll, you're already 2/3's through the game. a real shame.

Following that, a speedrunner and platformer lives or dies on it's controls... and while the game support both KB&M as well as gamepads.... the controls on either are not precise and have a mind of their own or the camera messes up and makes you jump of a ledge you never even saw coming.

And while i like the art style and graphical feel of the game, a severe lack of graphical options and settings does pull it down a bit, though not as much as the tons of graphical glitches, bugs and collision detection issues does.

Overall, i do like the idea of the game, but the execution is flawed in almost every way. A lot more time in the oven, with more content and more refined controls would have made this a great little title, but currently: it's a letdown.
